title: (x) Tales from the Powder Room - TF Forever Two {Yves}
content:
Headlines from Tatler Magazine. It's a Conde Nast   
pub, and they like to splurge, so I am betting it's custom.   
Still, I have an inkling that I've forgotten something.   
   
 ![tatler](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108193933im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28791.gif)

 [‹ (x) typolexikon.de - Adobe Jenson {Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108193933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3645 "Go to previous forum topic") [Ligne Roset logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108193933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3635 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Stephen Coles

comments.content: Looks like a [Treacyface](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108193933/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/) to me. Hold on.
Yup: TF Forever, Joseph's 1985 sans mega-family (32 weights)
Well golldarnit. You're schoolin' me today, Yves!
They did fix the M tho.

Okay, don't overdo it Stephen... it's starting to look   
suspicious now. Like agreed, the check is in the mail.   
Thanks again for making me look good. It's a pleasure   
doing business with you.   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108193933im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)

_\> They did fix the M tho._   
   
Actually we're looking at TF Forever Two, the version   
from 1986-92 with a single-storey lc "g" and the   
junction of the middle strokes of the uc "M" that extend   
to the baseline.   
   
I don't know if Joe could enlighten us; he posted   
a comment on another thread just recently.
